page.title: 13Convent and Churches.
page.content: The Marist Sisters had a{Children's {Home}but this was closed in{1984.}The premises have been converted and are being used as a Retreat and Conference Centre.The Ministry to Priests groups, Sisters'Retreats,handicapped and school children use the facilities. {St.Joseph's Church}has a piscina and a stone font,which was used as a cattle trough when found on Lutheredge Farm.They belonged to the{Saxon Kinley {Priory.}The carved woodwork was done by a local man.St.Bartholomew's Church has a lych-gate.Interesting entries in the Parish Register include the burial of Mary Smith aged 107 yrs.In 1725 and in 1687{King James II}went from Bathe to Gloucestr through this parish. Windows in St.Martin's Church show the story of his life.Outside there is an ancient noon stone across which the shadow of the church falls at noon.
